result.markdown:
---
title: "Subsetting"
format: html
---

There are various ways to subset a __tibble__. This sections shows the various methods with examples.

## Load data

The examples in this section use the `pie_crab` data from the [lterdatasampler package](/datasets/lterdatasampler.qmd) (includes install instructions).

Load package

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library("lterdatasampler")
```
:::


Create a __tibble__ from a subset of the pie_crab data.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl <- tibble::as_tibble(pie_crab[1:10,1:8])
pie_crab_tbl
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   date       latitude site   size air_temp air_temp_sd water_temp water_temp_sd
   <date>        <dbl> <chr> <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>
 1 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.4     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 2 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.2     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 3 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.5     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 4 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.9     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 5 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.4     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 6 2016-07-24       30 GTM    13.0     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 7 2016-07-24       30 GTM    10.3     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 8 2016-07-24       30 GTM    11.2     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 9 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.7     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
10 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.6     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
```


:::
:::


#### $

Extract a column using `$` and its column name


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl$site
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM" "GTM"
```


:::
:::



#### []

For when you subset a __tibble__ with `[]` you will always end up with a __tibble__.

This is different from a __data.frame__ where you may extract a [scalar](https://neof-workshops.github.io/R_j4c0xh/04-R_objects.html#scalar), [vector](https://neof-workshops.github.io/R_j4c0xh/04-R_objects.html#vectors-lists), or __data.frame__.

Below are examples using a subset of the `pie_crab` data from the [lterdatasampler package](/datasets/lterdatasampler.qmd) (includes install instructions).

#### Load data

Load package

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library("lterdatasampler")
```
:::


Create a __data.frame__ from a subset of the pie_crab data.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_df <- as.data.frame(pie_crab[1:10,1:8])
pie_crab_df
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
         date latitude site  size air_temp air_temp_sd water_temp water_temp_sd
1  2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.43   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
2  2016-07-24       30  GTM 14.18   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
3  2016-07-24       30  GTM 14.52   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
4  2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.94   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
5  2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.45   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
6  2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.99   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
7  2016-07-24       30  GTM 10.32   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
8  2016-07-24       30  GTM 11.19   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
9  2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.68   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
10 2016-07-24       30  GTM 14.55   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
```


:::
:::


Create a __tibble__ from a subset of the pie_crab data.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl <- tibble::as_tibble(pie_crab_df)
pie_crab_tbl
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 10 × 8
   date       latitude site   size air_temp air_temp_sd water_temp water_temp_sd
   <date>        <dbl> <chr> <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>
 1 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.4     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 2 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.2     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 3 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.5     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 4 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.9     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 5 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.4     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 6 2016-07-24       30 GTM    13.0     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 7 2016-07-24       30 GTM    10.3     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 8 2016-07-24       30 GTM    11.2     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
 9 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.7     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
10 2016-07-24       30 GTM    14.6     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
```


:::
:::


#### Extracting a value

Subsetting one value from a __data.frame__ leads to a __scalar__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_df[1,1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "2016-07-24"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
str(pie_crab_df[1,1])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 Date[1:1], format: "2016-07-24"
```


:::
:::


Subsetting one value from a __tibble__ leads to a __tibble__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl[1,1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 1
  date      
  <date>    
1 2016-07-24
```


:::
:::


#### Extracting a row

Subsetting a row from a __data.frame__ leads to a __data.frame__


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_df[1,]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
        date latitude site  size air_temp air_temp_sd water_temp water_temp_sd
1 2016-07-24       30  GTM 12.43   21.792       6.391     24.502         6.121
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
str(pie_crab_df[1,])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
'data.frame':	1 obs. of  8 variables:
 $ date         : Date, format: "2016-07-24"
 $ latitude     : num 30
 $ site         : chr "GTM"
 $ size         : num 12.4
 $ air_temp     : num 21.8
 $ air_temp_sd  : num 6.39
 $ water_temp   : num 24.5
 $ water_temp_sd: num 6.12
```


:::
:::


Subsetting a row from a __tibble__ leads to a __tibble__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl[1,]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 8
  date       latitude site   size air_temp air_temp_sd water_temp water_temp_sd
  <date>        <dbl> <chr> <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>
1 2016-07-24       30 GTM    12.4     21.8        6.39       24.5          6.12
```


:::
:::


#### Extracting a column

Subsetting a column from a __data.frame__ leads to a __vector__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_df[,1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24"
 [6] "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
str(pie_crab_df[,1])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 Date[1:10], format: "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" ...
```


:::
:::


Subsetting a column from a __tibble__ leads to a __tibble__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl[,1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 10 × 1
   date      
   <date>    
 1 2016-07-24
 2 2016-07-24
 3 2016-07-24
 4 2016-07-24
 5 2016-07-24
 6 2016-07-24
 7 2016-07-24
 8 2016-07-24
 9 2016-07-24
10 2016-07-24
```


:::
:::


#### Extracting a combo of columns and rows

Subsetting rows and columns together from a __data.frame__ leads to a __data.frame__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_df[1:3,1:3]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
        date latitude site
1 2016-07-24       30  GTM
2 2016-07-24       30  GTM
3 2016-07-24       30  GTM
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
str(pie_crab_df[1:3,1:3])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
'data.frame':	3 obs. of  3 variables:
 $ date    : Date, format: "2016-07-24" "2016-07-24" ...
 $ latitude: num  30 30 30
 $ site    : chr  "GTM" "GTM" "GTM"
```


:::
:::


Subsetting rows and columns together from a __tibble__ leads to a __tibble__

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pie_crab_tbl[1:3,1:3]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 3
  date       latitude site 
  <date>        <dbl> <chr>
1 2016-07-24       30 GTM  
2 2016-07-24       30 GTM  
3 2016-07-24       30 GTM  
```


:::
:::
